section.name: Base Configuration
section.p: Moria is dependent on three inital properties which has to be specified as system properties in the VM (or classloader, if your application server supports this functionality). The three are:

ol.li: no.feide.moria.configuration.base Should point to the Configuration Manager's base property file. Example: no.feide.moria.configuration.base=/full/path/base.properties

Dno.feide.moria.store.nodeid The JBossCache node ID for this instance. A unique (in the JBossCache cluster's context; see the Store Manager section) three-character alphanumeric string. Example: Dno.feide.moria.store.nodeid=xy1
log4j.configuration Log4j's configuration file (optional). Example: log4j.configuration=/full/path/log4j.xml

section.p: The last property may be considered optional as log4j on initialization has its own regime of locating its configuration, but this is the preferred way to do it when using Moria.
